modes.name: Q

long-description.section: Initial queries directed from the merchant to Kount that do not originate from a call center environment.
More description goes here in the future.

args.name: MODE
args.description: The type of the RIS post

valid-values.description: Initial queries to Kount from a call center environment

args.name: SESS
args.description: Merchant provided session ID. Must be unique over 30 day span

args.name: SITE
args.description: The name of the merchant's website

args.name: FRMT
args.description: Specify the format of the RIS response. If not specified, RIS response will be key/value pairs

valid-values.description: Response will be in XML format
Response will be in JSON format
Response will be in YAML format

args.name: CURR
args.description: The ISO 4217 currency code of the transaction

args.name: TOTL
args.description: Total authorized amount in lowest fractional currency value (USD = cents, GBP = pence, etc)

args.name: CASH
args.description: Cash value of any fencible items in the order in pennies of CURR

args.name: B2CC
args.description: Bill-to country code in ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 format

args.name: S2CC
args.description: Ship-to country code in ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 format

args.name: PTYP
args.description: Payment type. Not all types are available in all modes

args.name: PTOK
args.description: Hashed or masked payment token. Required for PTYP of CARD, CHEK, or BLML. For PTYP of PYPL or GOOG the PTOK is not required for mode Q, but must be provided in the mode U call related to this transaction

valid-values.description: Used for PTYP of CARD and PENC of KHASH
Used for other PTYPs with PENC of KHASH

args.name: PENC
args.description: Indicates the encoding of the PTOK. Required if hashing or masking the PTOK. Default value if not specified is KHASH

valid-values.description: PTOK encoded with Kount's proprietary hash (preferred)
PTYP must be CARD. First 6 and last 4 numbers of a credit card with remaining numbers masked with "Xs"

args.name: UNIQ
args.description: Customer unique ID or cookie set by merchant

args.name: EPOC
args.description: Epoch when UNIQ value was set

args.name: IPAD
args.description: Customer IP address (dotted quad format IPv4)

args.name: UAGT
args.example: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; Trident/7.0; rv:11.0) like Gecko

args.name: MACK
args.description: Merchant has acknowledged receipt of order and customer expects order will ship

args.name: PROD_TYPE[index (0,1...)]
args.description: For each index, a high level description of the item, such as TV or laptop

args.name: PROD_ITEM[index (0,1...)]
args.description: For each index, typically the SKU number for the item

args.name: PROD_DESC[index (0,1...)]
args.description: For each index, a specific description of the item. Can be an empty string

args.name: PROD_QUANT[index (0,1...)]
args.description: For each index, the quantity of the item being purchased

args.name: PROD_PRICE[index (0,1...)]
args.description: For each index, the price per unit in pennies

args.name: UDF[label]
args.type: associative array of strings, numbers, dates, or amounts
args.type-description: associative array of strings, numbers, dates, or amounts
args.description: User defined field that can store a string, number, date, or amount. The label and type must be registered in the Kount AWC under the DMC tab on the User Defined Fields page.

args.name: DOB
args.description: Date of birth of the customer formatted YYYY-MM-DD

args.name: SDK
args.description: The client library the user is using to make the RIS call, or CUST if a custom implementation

valid-values.description: Using no library or a custom library

args.name: LAST4
args.description: Last 4 digits in the payment token to validate against PTOK. This can only be done when PENC is not KHASH

reply.name: VERS
reply.description: The version of Kount called

reply.name: MODE
reply.description: The type of the RIS post

valid-values.description: Initial queries to Kount from a call center environment

reply.name: TRAN
reply.description: RIS Transaction ID

reply.name: MERC
reply.description: Kount assigned merchant ID number

reply.name: SESS
reply.description: Merchant provided session ID. Must be unique over 30 day span

reply.name: ORDR
reply.description: Merchant provided order number

reply.name: AUTO
reply.description: Auto descision response code

reply.name: REASON_CODE
reply.description: Custom reason code associated with rule action

reply.name: SCOR
reply.description: Kount score

reply.name: GEOX
reply.description: Persona related country with highest probability of fraud in ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 format

reply.name: BRND
reply.description: Brand of credit card used when payment type is credit card

reply.name: REGN
reply.description: ISO 3166-2 region code associated to device location

reply.name: NETW
reply.description: Riskiest network type associated with persona within the last 14 days

reply.name: KYCF
reply.description: Know Your Customer flag

reply.name: KAPT
reply.description: Whether or not device data was collected by the data collector process

reply.name: CARDS
reply.description: Total number of credit cards associated to persona as seen by Kount

reply.name: DEVICES
reply.description: Total number of unique devices associated to persona as seen by Kount

reply.name: EMAILS
reply.description: Total number of unique email addresses associated to persona as seen by Kount

reply.name: VELO
reply.description: Quantity of orders seen from this persona within the last 14 days. AUTH must be set to A

reply.name: VMAX
reply.description: Quantity of orders seen from this persona within the most active 6 hour window in the last 14 days. AUTH must be set to A

reply.name: SITE
reply.description: Website identifier of where the order originated

reply.name: DEVICE_LAYERS
reply.description: 5 device layers representing the operating system, browser, javascript settings, cookie setting, and flash settings. Device layers are used to create the device fingerprint

reply.name: FINGERPRINT
reply.description: The unique fingerprint of the device placing the order

reply.name: TIMEZONE
reply.description: The timezone the device owner has set on the device. The value is the number of minutes from Greenwhich Mean Time. Divide by 60 to get the number of hours

reply.name: LOCALTIME
reply.description: The local time the device owner has set on the device

reply.name: REGION
reply.description: ISO 3166-2 region code associated to GEOX location

reply.name: COUNTRY
reply.description: Country code associated with the device in ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 format

reply.name: PROXY
reply.description: A flag to indicate if a proxy server was detected with this order

reply.name: JAVASCRIPT
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the device placing the order has javascript enabled

reply.name: FLASH
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the device placing the order has flash enabled

reply.name: COOKIES
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the device placing the order has cookies enabled

reply.name: HTTP_COUNTRY
reply.description: User home country the device owner has set in ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 format

reply.name: LANGUAGE
reply.description: The lanauge the device owner has set

reply.name: MOBILE_DEVICE
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the device placing the order is a mobile device (smartphone, tablet, etc)

reply.name: MOBILE_TYPE
reply.description: The type of mobile device

reply.name: MOBILE_FORWARDER
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the mobile device is using a forwarder to process the carrier's service

reply.name: VOICE_DEVICE
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the mobile device is voice activated

reply.name: PC_REMOTE
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the device is enabled to use PC remote software

reply.name: RULES_TRIGGERED
reply.description: Number of rules triggered by the RIS post

reply.name: RULE_ID_N
reply.description: The rule ID associated with the Nth rule that triggered

reply.name: RULE_DESCRIPTION_N
reply.description: The rule description associated with the Nth rule that triggered

reply.name: CBD_*
reply.description: LexisNexis Chargeback Defender responses. For details on these, please contact Kount

reply.name: COUNTERS_TRIGGERED
reply.description: Number of unique counter names triggered during rules evaluation

reply.name: COUNTER_NAME_N
reply.description: The name associated with the Nth counter triggered

reply.name: COUNTER_VALUE_N
reply.description: The number of times the Nth counter was triggered

reply.name: INSTANTID_*
reply.description: LexisNexis Instant ID responses. For details on these, please contact Kount

reply.name: MASTERCARD
reply.description: Fraud score provided by MasterCard. Range is 0-999. Higher is more indication of fraud

reply.name: DDFS
reply.description: Date device was first seen

reply.name: DSR
reply.description: Device screen resolution

reply.name: UAS
reply.description: User agent string
reply.example: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9a8)

reply.name: BROWSER
reply.description: Web browser

reply.name: OS
reply.description: Operating system

reply.description: Pierced IP address (dotted quad format IPv4)

reply.name: PIP_LAT

reply.name: PIP_LON
reply.description: Pierced IP address longitude

reply.name: PIP_CITY

reply.name: PIP_ORG

reply.name: IP_IPAD

reply.name: IP_LON

reply.name: ERROR_COUNT
reply.description: Number of errors this call created

reply.name: WARNING_COUNT

More description goes here in the future.

modes.name: J

long-description.section: RIS Mode J evaluates only the customer specific fraud thresholds, filters and lists (Thresholds) that were configured in Kount Central Fraud Manager.
The RIS Response includes a list of any Thresholds that triggered, as well as the data that caused the threshold(s) to trigger.

args.name: MODE
args.description: The type of the RIS post

valid-values.description: Initial queries to Kount from a call center environment

args.name: SESS
args.description: Merchant provided session ID. Must be unique over 30 day span

args.name: SITE
args.description: The name of the merchant's website

args.name: FRMT
args.description: Specify the format of the RIS response. If not specified, RIS response will be key/value pairs

valid-values.description: Response will be in XML format
Response will be in JSON format
Response will be in YAML format

args.name: CURR
args.description: The ISO 4217 currency code of the transaction

args.name: TOTL
args.description: Total authorized amount in lowest fractional currency value (USD = cents, GBP = pence, etc)

args.name: CASH
args.description: Cash value of any fencible items in the order in pennies of CURR

args.name: B2CC
args.description: Bill-to country code in ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 format

args.name: S2CC
args.description: Ship-to country code in ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 format

args.name: PTYP
args.description: Payment type. Not all types are available in all modes

args.name: PTOK
args.description: Hashed or masked payment token. Required for PTYP of CARD, CHEK, or BLML. For PTYP of PYPL or GOOG the PTOK is not required for mode Q, but must be provided in the mode U call related to this transaction

valid-values.description: Used for PTYP of CARD and PENC of KHASH
Used for other PTYPs with PENC of KHASH

args.name: PENC
args.description: Indicates the encoding of the PTOK. Required if hashing or masking the PTOK. Default value if not specified is KHASH

valid-values.description: PTOK encoded with Kount's proprietary hash (preferred)
PTYP must be CARD. First 6 and last 4 numbers of a credit card with remaining numbers masked with "Xs"

args.name: UNIQ
args.description: Customer unique ID or cookie set by merchant

args.name: EPOC
args.description: Epoch when UNIQ value was set

args.name: IPAD
args.description: Customer IP address (dotted quad format IPv4)

args.name: UAGT
args.example: User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; Trident/7.0; rv:11.0) like Gecko

args.name: MACK
args.description: Merchant has acknowledged receipt of order and customer expects order will ship

args.name: PROD_TYPE[index (0,1...)]
args.description: For each index, a high level description of the item, such as TV or laptop

args.name: PROD_ITEM[index (0,1...)]
args.description: For each index, typically the SKU number for the item

args.name: PROD_DESC[index (0,1...)]
args.description: For each index, a specific description of the item. Can be an empty string

args.name: PROD_QUANT[index (0,1...)]
args.description: For each index, the quantity of the item being purchased

args.name: PROD_PRICE[index (0,1...)]
args.description: For each index, the price per unit in pennies

args.name: UDF[label]
args.type: associative array of strings, numbers, dates, or amounts
args.type-description: associative array of strings, numbers, dates, or amounts
args.description: User defined field that can store a string, number, date, or amount. The label and type must be registered in the Kount AWC under the DMC tab on the User Defined Fields page.

args.name: DOB
args.description: Date of birth of the customer formatted YYYY-MM-DD

args.name: SDK
args.description: The client library the user is using to make the RIS call, or CUST if a custom implementation

valid-values.description: Using no library or a custom library

args.name: LAST4
args.description: Last 4 digits in the payment token to validate against PTOK. This can only be done when PENC is not KHASH

modes.name: W
modes.short-description: Initial queries to Kount with thresholds

long-description.section: Mode W is basically a Mode Q with Mode J response appended to the end. Thresholds are evaluated in addition to Kount Central Portfolio Manager rules.
More description goes here in the future.

reply.name: VERS
reply.description: The version of Kount called

reply.name: MODE
reply.description: The type of the RIS post

valid-values.description: Initial queries to Kount from a call center environment

reply.name: TRAN
reply.description: RIS Transaction ID

reply.name: MERC
reply.description: Kount assigned merchant ID number

reply.name: SESS
reply.description: Merchant provided session ID. Must be unique over 30 day span

reply.name: ORDR
reply.description: Merchant provided order number

reply.name: AUTO
reply.description: Auto descision response code

reply.name: REASON_CODE
reply.description: Custom reason code associated with rule action

reply.name: SCOR
reply.description: Kount score

reply.name: GEOX
reply.description: Persona related country with highest probability of fraud in ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 format

reply.name: BRND
reply.description: Brand of credit card used when payment type is credit card

reply.name: REGN
reply.description: ISO 3166-2 region code associated to device location

reply.name: NETW
reply.description: Riskiest network type associated with persona within the last 14 days

reply.name: KYCF
reply.description: Know Your Customer flag

reply.name: KAPT
reply.description: Whether or not device data was collected by the data collector process

reply.name: CARDS
reply.description: Total number of credit cards associated to persona as seen by Kount

reply.name: DEVICES
reply.description: Total number of unique devices associated to persona as seen by Kount

reply.name: EMAILS
reply.description: Total number of unique email addresses associated to persona as seen by Kount

reply.name: VELO
reply.description: Quantity of orders seen from this persona within the last 14 days. AUTH must be set to A

reply.name: VMAX
reply.description: Quantity of orders seen from this persona within the most active 6 hour window in the last 14 days. AUTH must be set to A

reply.name: SITE
reply.description: Website identifier of where the order originated

reply.name: DEVICE_LAYERS
reply.description: 5 device layers representing the operating system, browser, javascript settings, cookie setting, and flash settings. Device layers are used to create the device fingerprint

reply.name: FINGERPRINT
reply.description: The unique fingerprint of the device placing the order

reply.name: TIMEZONE
reply.description: The timezone the device owner has set on the device. The value is the number of minutes from Greenwhich Mean Time. Divide by 60 to get the number of hours

reply.name: LOCALTIME
reply.description: The local time the device owner has set on the device

reply.name: REGION
reply.description: ISO 3166-2 region code associated to GEOX location

reply.name: COUNTRY
reply.description: Country code associated with the device in ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 format

reply.name: PROXY
reply.description: A flag to indicate if a proxy server was detected with this order

reply.name: JAVASCRIPT
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the device placing the order has javascript enabled

reply.name: FLASH
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the device placing the order has flash enabled

reply.name: COOKIES
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the device placing the order has cookies enabled

reply.name: HTTP_COUNTRY
reply.description: User home country the device owner has set in ISO 3166-1 Alpha 2 format

reply.name: LANGUAGE
reply.description: The lanauge the device owner has set

reply.name: MOBILE_DEVICE
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the device placing the order is a mobile device (smartphone, tablet, etc)

reply.name: MOBILE_TYPE
reply.description: The type of mobile device

reply.name: MOBILE_FORWARDER
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the mobile device is using a forwarder to process the carrier's service

reply.name: VOICE_DEVICE
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the mobile device is voice activated

reply.name: PC_REMOTE
reply.description: A flag to indicate if the device is enabled to use PC remote software

reply.name: RULES_TRIGGERED
reply.description: Number of rules triggered by the RIS post

reply.name: RULE_ID_N
reply.description: The rule ID associated with the Nth rule that triggered

reply.name: RULE_DESCRIPTION_N
reply.description: The rule description associated with the Nth rule that triggered

reply.name: CBD_*
reply.description: LexisNexis Chargeback Defender responses. For details on these, please contact Kount

reply.name: COUNTERS_TRIGGERED
reply.description: Number of unique counter names triggered during rules evaluation

reply.name: COUNTER_NAME_N
reply.description: The name associated with the Nth counter triggered

reply.name: COUNTER_VALUE_N
reply.description: The number of times the Nth counter was triggered

reply.name: INSTANTID_*
reply.description: LexisNexis Instant ID responses. For details on these, please contact Kount

reply.name: MASTERCARD
reply.description: Fraud score provided by MasterCard. Range is 0-999. Higher is more indication of fraud

reply.name: DDFS
reply.description: Date device was first seen

reply.name: DSR
reply.description: Device screen resolution

reply.name: UAS
reply.description: User agent string

modes.name: U

long-description.section: Update call to Kount, does not cause a reevaluation of the transaction but will update what is displayed in the Agent Web Console (AWC). This update call does not count towards the number of RIS transactions purchased. Only certain fields can be updated with MODE=U calls
More description goes here in the future.

args.name: MODE
args.description: The type of the RIS post

valid-values.description: Initial queries to Kount from a call center environment

args.name: SESS
args.description: Merchant provided session ID. Must be unique over 30 day span

args.name: FRMT
args.description: Specify the format of the RIS response. If not specified, RIS response will be key/value pairs

valid-values.description: Response will be in XML format
Response will be in JSON format
Response will be in YAML format

args.name: PTYP
args.description: Payment type. Not all types are available in all modes

args.name: PTOK
args.description: Hashed or masked payment token. Required for PTYP of CARD, CHEK, or BLML. For PTYP of PYPL or GOOG the PTOK is not required for mode Q, but must be provided in the mode U call related to this transaction

valid-values.description: Used for PTYP of CARD and PENC of KHASH
Used for other PTYPs with PENC of KHASH

args.name: PENC
args.description: Indicates the encoding of the PTOK. Required if hashing or masking the PTOK. Default value if not specified is KHASH

valid-values.description: PTOK encoded with Kount's proprietary hash (preferred)
PTYP must be CARD. First 6 and last 4 numbers of a credit card with remaining numbers masked with "Xs"

args.name: MACK
args.description: Merchant has acknowledged receipt of order and customer expects order will ship

args.name: LAST4
args.description: Last 4 digits in the payment token to validate against PTOK. This can only be done when PENC is not KHASH

args.name: RFCB
args.description: Indicates if a refund or chargeback has taken place
